page.title: 03TRANSPORT AND COMMUNICATIONS
page.content:
The A32 road runs north/south(Reading to Gosport)by the villages. Most of the traffic on this road is light vehicles, although some heavy lorries use this route from the coast to the M.3 and thence to London. The B.3035 goes west to Bishop's Waltham and carries mostly local traffic from the villages to shops, banks and schools in Bishop's Waltham. All the area is covered by Telecommunication. There are 5 post boxes in the area,each having 2 collections per day. There are also 2 postal deliveries per day.
The beacon on Beacon Hill has been lit in recent times such as on Queen Elizabeth II's Silver Jubilee.
